column4: how do i know what packages will be added to the repositories by canonical and when?
What do you mean?
i installed a package with aptitude. i would like to install a newer version without compiling it (to avoid the 'dependency hell' problem).
What version do you have, and what version do you want? (and what package is it?)
newsbeuter. the repositories have 0.7 and i am interested in a newer one.
(it's amazing rss client, text-based)
0.9.1 is in Intrepid
So, if you don't want to wait, you could backport that for your own personal use
cool. should i use prevu?
I would.  For something like that it should work without any catches as well (although I can't say for sure, can't see the depends at the moment)
is there a site where i can see all this data as well? (what packages will be in the next ubuntu)
packages.ubuntu.com  but the searching functionality is broken at the moment.
unop thanks
prevu needs at "least a few hundred megabytes of available storage under /var to function" is there a 'cheapest' way ?
You only need it while its building, you can remove it afterwards
(the space, and prevu too, for that matter)
so aptitude remove will free it?
No, since the space it takes up won't be covered by package management.  You'll just go in and  remove the directory
got it. thanks
You'll probably have more luck in #ubuntu-motu
ok.
